meanings.definition: A group of similar things or people positioned or occurring closely together.
meanings.sent1: The teacher pointed to the clusters of students working together on the project.
meanings.sent2: The clusters of stars in the night sky were mesmerizing.
meanings.sent3: The clusters of colorful balloons made the room look like a party.
meanings.sent4: The clusters of ideas in her mind were like puzzle pieces waiting to be connected.
meanings.sent5: The clusters of flowers in the garden created a beautiful display of colors.

meanings.definition: A small group of people or things.
meanings.sent1: She invited a few close friends to join the small clusters for a movie night.
meanings.sent2: The clusters of trees in the park provided shade on a hot summer day.
meanings.sent3: The clusters of ducks waddling in a line looked like a mini parade.
meanings.sent4: The clusters of books on her shelf were neatly organized by genre.
meanings.sent5: The clusters of seashells on the beach were a treasure trove for collectors.
